intro: Euparea linarina, commonly known as the narrow-leaf euparea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Argentina and Chile, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. It produces a milky latex when damaged, a common feature among members of its family. Euparea linarina is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
